question_stem.en: A research group conducted a placebo-controlled clinical trial to assess whether a new drug to treat acute migraine with or without aura in adults is more effective than standard therapy. A total of 3,500 patients with acute migraine were enrolled in the study and randomly assigned to either the new drug or standard treatment. During the data analysis phase, the researchers decide to set alpha at 0.01 rather than 0.05. Which of the following is the most likely result of this change? {{exhibit_1}}
question_stem.zh: 一个研究小组进行了一项安慰剂对照临床试验，以评估一种治疗成人急性偏头痛（伴或不伴先兆）的新药是否比标准疗法更有效。共有 3,500 名急性偏头痛患者参与了这项研究，并被随机分配到新药组或标准治疗组。在数据分析阶段，研究人员决定将 alpha 设置为 0.01 而不是 0.05。以下哪项最可能是这一改变的结果？{{exhibit_1}}

question.en: Which of the following is the most likely result of this change?
question.zh: 以下哪项最可能是这一改变的结果？

A.en: Any significant findings will be reported with greater confidence
A.zh: 任何显著发现都将以更大的置信度报告

B.en: There will be a higher probability of a type I error
B.zh: 将有更高的 I 型错误概率

C.en: There will be a higher probability of finding statistically significant results
C.zh: 找到具有统计学意义结果的概率会更高

D.en: There will be a lower probability of a type II error
D.zh: 将有较低的 II 型错误概率

E.en: The study will have more statistical power
E.zh: 该研究将具有更大的统计功效

explanation.en:
Alpha (α) is the significance level used to establish the statistical significance of study results. It is usually predetermined by investigators as the threshold to reject a null hypothesis (H₀). The results of a study are considered statistically significant when the p-value (ie, probability of obtaining results as extreme as the observed results when H₀ is true) is less than the significance level (ie, p-value < α). Alpha is also the probability of making a TYPE I ERROR, which is rejecting a true H₀ (ie, a false positive: finding a statistically significant difference when one does not truly exist). The complement of alpha/significance level is the CONFIDENCE LEVEL (1 – α), which represents the probability of not rejecting a true H₀ (ie, a true negative, or not finding a statistically significant difference when one does not truly exist).

The lower the significance level, the lower the probability of a type I error. However, this means that the threshold to attain statistical significance is more stringent. Therefore, REDUCING THE SIGNIFICANCE LEVEL (eg, from α = 5% to α = 1%) DECREASES the probability of a TYPE I ERROR along with the probability of finding statistical significance (eg, p-value < 0.05 to p-value < 0.01) (Choices B and C). A decreased significance level also means an INCREASED CONFIDENCE LEVEL (1 – α); therefore, any statistically significant findings can be reported with a greater level of confidence.

(Choices D and E) A Type II error occurs when a false H₀ is not rejected (ie, a false negative: not finding a statistically significant difference when one truly exists). The probability of a type II error (known as beta [β]) is the complement of power (1 – β). Statistical power is the probability of rejecting a false H₀. That is, the power to find a statistically significant difference when one truly exists (ie, true positive). Reducing the significance level from 0.05 to 0.01 makes the threshold to attain statistical significance more stringent. Consequently, the study will have less statistical power to detect a statistically significant difference when one truly exists and will have a higher probability of a type II error (the complement of power).

Educational objective: Reducing the significance level alpha (α) in a study allows researchers to report any significant findings with greater confidence.
explanation.zh:
Alpha (α) 是用于确定研究结果统计学意义的显著性水平。它通常由研究人员预先确定为拒绝原假设 (H₀) 的阈值。当 p 值（即，在 H₀ 为真时获得与观察结果一样极端的概率）小于显著性水平（即，p 值 < α）时，研究结果被认为具有统计学意义。Alpha 也是犯 I 型错误的概率，即拒绝真实的 H₀（即，假阳性：在实际上不存在统计学意义的差异时发现统计学意义的差异）。 Alpha/显著性水平的补数是置信水平 (1 – α)，它表示不拒绝真实的 H₀（即，真阴性，或在实际上不存在统计学意义的差异时未发现统计学意义的差异）的概率。

显著性水平越低，I 型错误的概率就越低。 然而，这意味着要获得统计学意义的阈值更加严格。因此，降低显著性水平（例如，从 α = 5% 到 α = 1%）会降低 I 型错误的概率以及找到统计学意义的概率（例如，p 值 < 0.05 到 p 值 < 0.01）（选项 B 和 C）。 显著性水平降低也意味着置信水平升高 (1 – α)； 因此，任何具有统计学意义的发现都可以用更高的置信水平来报告。

(选项 D 和 E) 当未拒绝错误的 H₀ 时会发生 II 型错误（即，假阴性：在实际上存在统计学意义的差异时未发现统计学意义的差异）。 II 型错误的概率（称为 β）是功效的补数 (1 – β)。统计功效是拒绝错误的 H₀ 的概率。 也就是说，在实际上存在统计学意义的差异时找到统计学意义的差异的功效（即，真阳性）。 将显著性水平从 0.05 降低到 0.01 使获得统计学意义的阈值更加严格。 因此，当实际上存在统计学意义的差异时，该研究将缺乏检测统计学意义差异的统计功效，并且将具有更高的 II 型错误概率（功效的补数）。

教育目标：在研究中降低显著性水平 alpha (α) 允许研究人员以更大的置信度报告任何显著发现。

summary.en:
This question tests the understanding of statistical significance, alpha levels, type I and type II errors, and statistical power in clinical research. It assesses the impact of changing the alpha level on the confidence, probability of errors, and power of a study.

To solve this question, understand that decreasing the alpha level makes it harder to reject the null hypothesis, reducing the chance of a type I error but increasing the chance of a type II error. This also increases the confidence level in any statistically significant findings.
summary.zh:
这个问题测试对临床研究中统计学意义、alpha 水平、I 型和 II 型错误以及统计功效的理解。它评估了改变 alpha 水平对研究的置信度、错误概率和功效的影响。

要解决这个问题，请理解降低 alpha 水平会使拒绝原假设变得更加困难，从而降低 I 型错误的几率，但会增加 II 型错误的几率。 这也增加了任何具有统计学意义的发现的置信水平。
